documents.document: @autumnbreezed Stuff, even. ;)
@autumnbreezed Yeah, I was in the store on Saint Catherine with Duncan this week looking at sofas and tables. Very nice stiff!
@autumnbreezed #couchenvy
We invented chocolate milk?! I knew our cows were special but this is amazing. https://t.co/IwYQUXoRUX
@SimonJ_McD https://t.co/3aNPGSfnaf
@GameDesignDan Could have been worse. Could have been for that new Coco Pop abomination.
@jemalexander Your prince is in another castle.

@jemalexander Grim ‘Axe’ Gaydar: One man’s obsession with consuming Tom Holland.
One ticket, please.
I just momentarily forgot what the T in STEM stands for. Jesus fucking Christ. #seniormoment
Climbing tonight. Might climb in a duffel jacket to mix things up.
@colossalblue Or you could just delete Skype. Because Skype is evil incarnate.
@david4482 Sauron seems pissed. Again.
@DonH1981 @JenuinePanic No board is big enough to sate my insatiable need for property.
@DonH1981 @JenuinePanic This is funny because just last night we were talking about buying more property in Montréal. I can’t stop. It’s an addiction.
@bursaar @brianlelas @nathaliemc In the queue to immigrate to Canada the officials saw Toby and insisted we jump to the top of the queue. They have their advantages.
@SimonJ_McD Take Savile Row.
I got an email confirming a purchase on PSN as I was commuting home. Short version: keep your controllers out of the reach of inquisitive button-mashing 2 year-olds.
@bursaar Same.
I’ve been cutting down on chocolate lately. Not tonight, though. Not after this week. Not to-fucking-night, son. #nyom #diabetes
@Danbojones Your student loan is going to disappoint you hard, drop out, and join a folk band. It never calls.
@maplebetrayer I’m sure one of my old colleagues could hook me up.
*chuckles en français* https://t.co/ATZDFmTxGe
@DonH1981 I heard it’s a great movie, Don.
@PhillipCostigan All glory to the Fan God.
@Tuffcub @mynameisblair That’s where you would be wrong! Business/risk analysis and management is an integral part of game dev and where I work.
@Tuffcub @mynameisblair Sure! Come on over. The people are great and the titles are AAA :D
@mynameisblair Can you legally work in Canada? We got game jobs exploding out of the rocks over here.
@autumnbreezed Yeah, they’re rebooting and pretending everything after Terminator 2 didn’t happen. Deadpool director directing. Cameron is producing.
Holy shit. #nofate https://t.co/umUM9uAnCK
@Braxifen Perpetual Brendans gets me every time.
Forgot my climbing shorts so I had to climb in jeans like some sort of denim degenerate.
@DonH1981 This I don’t believe for one second.
@GavinDYoung @MBMBaM Dan Brown is awesome.
@DonH1981 I was actually going to use that expression but thought better of it because it sounds so British.
@DonH1981 This really bothers you, doesn’t it?
@LeeCarus Done! https://t.co/fyMudzpdCO
@autumnbreezed Adorable.
@autumnbreezed Wait. Ma blonde is a thing? I love this place.

Toby has started forming sentences. So far we have “I want food”, “This is broken”, and “Oh I see you left your phone down for a second let me get that for you oh fuck I just dropped it sorry about that.”
@pjohalloran PJ now connecting the dots. #allroadsleadtomoscow https://t.co/NFQUqGAJKc
@mynameisblair I’d make it fast if I were you; everyone is jumping on the Canadian bandwagon. We’re going to be full up soon. That said, shocking amount of game jobs going a begging.
@mynameisblair Ask for only ketchup on the kid’s cheeseburger but mangle the words just enough with your celt brogue that she hears “only mustard”. Then add ketchup manually yourself.
@pjohalloran Thought you might appreciate this. It takes into account population density. Not so red now, eh? :) https://t.co/I493QAg9hA
Five Guys made a mistake with my order so they gave me a replacement burger. They wouldn’t take the mistake burger back. What I’m trying to say is that I ate both burgers. Don’t judge me.
@r_geoghegan Yep, cycled past that today. Did a double take.
@david4482 “Get yer moon rock. Five for fifty.”

Re: that last RT. There’s a great story about a bunch of kids from Finglas concocting a way to find $5m worth of lost moon rock in their local dump just begging to be written. In fact, I might just have to write it.
“Alexa, search for the most Irish thing ever.” https://t.co/WsIvfVpMH2

@autumnbreezed I could message them in Irish …
😆
Street names in Verdun highlighting the borrough’s Irish heritage. The Rue Dublin sign is falling apart. I’m screaming. https://t.co/j2TICq0JJ1
@tomwillfixit ShitItCon.

@JenuinePanic More efficient muscles means you burn fat better even when not exercising. That last image was from a few minutes ago in the weight room at climbing. Now it’s time for some Moon Wall. https://t.co/PhgupGpEdx
@JenuinePanic As someone who has done a LOT of cardio in my time, it is the devil. https://t.co/NvSlEleDVJ
@tomwillfixit That look your father gives you when you says it’s okay I’ll just put the container inside a container.
@colossalblue Northern Discordian BASTIDS.
@tomwillfixit Cool. If that happens I will send you something in return.
@tomwillfixit I’d take it but we both know I’m not in Ireland and I’m unlikely to ever play it. :)
@Garymaphone @autumnbreezed The Steph Train is both punctual and reliable.
@DonH1981 Sure. If it was intentional. I get that.
@DonH1981 You can. You can’t use punctuation with it, though. ;)
@autumnbreezed Whenever I see the notification at 9:05 in the channel I immediately see you in my mind’s eye as the theme song from Friends starts playing.
@DonH1981 Wow. I mean, that’s not how you spell dinosaurs. ;)
@Michael_French She was added later.
@elliejoypanic Suspicious absence of Super Mario Odyssey on this list. ;)

@Braxifen @NoMansSky backlog++;
;)

@Braxifen @NoMansSky I should have mentioned that I will be playing with him at all times. Nate has had very little exposure to games (ironic considering his dad’s job). When Sonic hit the spikes he lost his shit.
@Braxifen @NoMansSky I know lots of languages. I’ve also managed the whole breathing thing for 40 years. I got this. :)
@AlexBurby @edfear Jamie Dornan or GTFO. https://t.co/GM2hErYfUB
@PhillipCostigan Good luck?
@Braxifen @NoMansSky Would you recommend for a space mad 6 year old?
@covernode Out of my head, Wilson!
@covernode Wolf Blitzer also haunts my dreams.
@jenjeahaly DO EEET.
@DonH1981 Worth it.
@autumnbreezed Same. Shit. Wait.
@jaimebuelta Lies.
@autumnbreezed This makes me sad. But I can relate. 💕

@JenuinePanic @autumnbreezed You may read this novel so I don’t want to give away any spoilers. All I’ll say is that it’s not a plot device or because Stephenson is trying to empower anyone. It also happens “off-page”. It’s subtly referenced, not described.

@JenuinePanic @autumnbreezed @keithoconor I was not a fan of RP1. Less about the pastiche to what was also my childhood (Cline is five years older than me) but more about the juvenile themes of “getting the girl” etc.
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic @keithoconor I have read both. The tone and delivery couldn’t be more different. Also, any novel whose main character is called Hiro Protagonist is okay in my book ;)
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic However, if I remember correctly, there is at least one instance of violence against the protagonist (a woman) in The Diamond Age. That said, it’s handled tactfully.
@autumnbreezed @JenuinePanic Another one of my favourites. Though my wife actually prefers Stephenson’s The Diamond Age to it. Which, admittedly, is more steampunk than cyberpunk.
@JenuinePanic Neuromancer. Also has an amazing female character in Molly Millions.
Syncing local files with Spotify: a fucking excruciating arcane blood-ritual about as intuitive as Arabian shorthand.
@autumnbreezed Exactly what you’d expect a Verdun vampire to say. ;)

@colossalblue https://t.co/C7uMGi57CV
https://t.co/GZ3D8yisya
@GavinDYoung I must have missed the memo ;)
https://t.co/iJImvxHVRH https://t.co/Lw7oFJ0tig
Well, that and the vampires. #lesvampsdeverdun
Worst thing about now living in Verdun is that the metro delves deep between LaSalle and Charlevoix and I lose internet connection for about three minutes. #firstworldproblems
@LeeCarus Congrats on the launch, Lee.
@BenParfitt Congrats, Ben. Welcome to the other side.
@wrossmck Winter is coming.
@DenmanRooke Can you recommend a good painting app on the iPad for kids?
@DonH1981 I admire you standing by your newfound principles.

@DonH1981 You need a comma when adding detail. “The runner, Don, won the race.” Note the pause. You can remove the commas (and Don) completely and the sentence makes sense. In this case the comma is not needed as Director is his title; it doesn’t add context.
@DonH1981 All my property is in Swords. And I actually charge less than the average. Because I’m not a gowl.
@DonH1981 I still am.
@autumnbreezed Yep. And Ranelagh, while close to the city centre, is not the nicest of places. It’s absolutely crazy. People spending exorbitant amounts for the tiniest of places.
@SimonJ_McD It finally happened. :) https://t.co/VTmr60BkPf
